technology.short_description: Every Bretonnian Lord knows that honour and chivalry come before everything.

effects.description: Chivalry: +50
Armour: +5 for Lords and embedded Heroes
Leadership: +5 for Lords and embedded Heroes

technology.short_description: Banish uncertainty: invest in the kingdom's future.

effects.description: Growth: +10
Income from Province Capital/Settlement buildings: +5%

technology.short_description: For what is a peasant without his pitchfork?

effects.description: Recruitment cost: -50% for Peasant Mob units
Melee attack: +10 for Peasant Mob units

technology.short_description: More food means less peasant corpses to cleanup.

effects.description: Casualty replenishment rate: +10% for non-Knight units
Upkeep: -25% for Peasant Mob units

technology.short_description: “Rejoice, peasants! For a generous Knight of Bretonnia provides for you!”

effects.description: Chivalry: +200
Control: +2

technology.short_description: For those not born into nobility, there are few ways to gain the Lady's favour.

effects.description: Melee attack: +4 for Battle Pilgrims and Grail Reliquae units
Melee defence: +4 for Battle Pilgrims and Grail Reliquae units

technology.short_description: Paladins are expected to donate large sums of their inheritance to the cult of the Lady.

effects.description: Chivalry: +200
Hero recruit rank: +4 for Paladins and Sons of Bretonnia
Ward save: 10% for Grail Knight and Grail Guardian units and embedded Paladin Heroes

technology.short_description: Repanse was no more than seventeen years of age when she, inspired by her vision, broke open the reliquary of the village chapel and took up the famed sword inside. Snatched the tapestry hung on the wall and fastened it to a lance. Donned the armour of a slain Knight and grabbed the reigns of his terrified warhorse and rode forth.

attributes.bullet_text: Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.
When attacking braced charge defenders, this unit only loses half of its charge bonus.
Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.
Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.
The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).
This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.
This unit can block projectiles regardless of its facing.
This unit can block projectiles regardless of its facing.
This unit can block projectiles regardless of its facing.
When bracing, this unit negates the charge bonus of any attacker.
When bracing, this unit negates the charge bonus of any attacker.
When bracing, this unit negates the charge bonus of any attacker.
When bracing, this unit causes additional damage when attacking charging enemies.

effects.description: Number of uses: +1 for faction army ability

technology.short_description: Fair Aquitaine: a land of rolling fields, sandy shores... and incessant noble feuds.

effects.description: Enables an opportunity to confederate with Aquitaine
Chivalry: +100
Diplomatic relations: +100 with Aquitaine

technology.short_description: Lyonesse, the homeland of the most devoted of all the Grail Companions.

effects.description: Enables an opportunity to confederate with Lyonesse
Chivalry: +100
Diplomatic relations: +100 with Lyonesse

technology.short_description: The ongoing Errantry Wars across the sea need constant political and financial support.

effects.description: Chivalry: +100
Diplomatic relations: +50 with Chevaliers de Lyonesse
Diplomatic relations: +100 with Thegan's Errantry, Knights of the Flame, Knights of Origo and Jerrod's Errantry

technology.short_description: Dealing with the ill-tempered, easily-angered Dwarfs tests every ounce of a diplomat's capabilities, so oft-times the King leads the charm offensive himself lest misunderstandings lead to war.

effects.description: Diplomatic relations: +50 with Dwarfs
Ammunition: +10% for Missile Infantry units

technology.short_description: The poor must be cared for, just enough to ensure productivity.

effects.description: Growth: +10
Leadership: +10 for Peasant Mob units

technology.short_description: Know your population, know the size of your army.

effects.description: Recruit rank: +2 for Peasant Mob units
Local recruitment capacity: +1

technology.short_description: While wood is plentiful, carpentry skills remain relatively rare and so are prized in Bretonnia.

effects.description: Construction time: -1 for Province Capital/Settlement buildings
Income from Timber industry: +50%

technology.short_description: Better woodworking techniques allow for longer, more sturdy spears and polearms.

effects.description: Melee attack: +4 for Spearmen-at-Arms, Men-at-Arms (Polearms) and Mounted Yeomen units
Weapon strength: +10% for Spearmen-at-Arms, Men-at-Arms (Polearms) and Mounted Yeomen units

technology.short_description: Disheartened and retreating knights saw a mere damsel bravely setting off to do battle with the mighty warriors of Chaos, and one who was undoubtedly favoured by the Lady of the Lake, they were shamed and felt honour-bound to follow her to death or glory.

effects.description: Melee defence: +4 when defending

Physical resistance: 1% per rank achieved
	(faction leader's army)

technology.short_description: good roads are essential and of course a few taverns along the way

effects.description: Knights Errant and Questing Knights are more durable when above 75%% health
Army ability: "Chivalry is All!" Summon 2 units of Defenders of the Realm

technology.short_description: Among the cliffs, peaks, and mountain ranges, the pegasi soar.

effects.description: Enables an opportunity to confederate with Parravon
Chivalry: +100
Diplomatic relations: +100 with Parravon

technology.short_description: Bastonne, birthplace of the Uniter and the source of his bloodline.

effects.description: Enables an opportunity to confederate with Bastonne
Chivalry: +100
Diplomatic relations: +100 with Bastonne

technology.short_description: King Louen knows Bretonnia cannot stem the tide of filth alone – diplomacy is required to broker alliances, lest fell darkness overrun the world entirely.

effects.description: Diplomatic relations: +50 with Humans, High Elves and Lizardmen
Character experience gain per turn: +100

technology.short_description: Men tend to understand each other's motives, so diplomacy between factions is simply a matter of balancing competing interests for mutual advantage.

effects.description: Diplomatic relations: +50 with Empire, Kislev and Southern Realms
Income from trade tariffs: +10%

technology.short_description: A seaworthy fleet keeps the economy afloat.

effects.description: Tradable resources produced: +10%

technology.short_description: Bribing the harbourmaster pays dividends on import duties.

effects.description: Construction cost: -25% for Ports
Income from trade tariffs: +10%

technology.short_description: Tools made of metal... Better not show you have them.

effects.description: Construction cost: -10% for Infrastructure buildings

technology.short_description: Once the town census has been undertaken, its easy to round the peons up for military service.

effects.description: Global recruitment capacity: +1
Upkeep: -5% for non-Knight units

technology.short_description: Those peasants skilled at bow-making are ordered to do it year round, instead of supplying a village's quota.

effects.description: Ammunition: +10%
Range: +10% for Peasant Bowmen, Herrimaults and Mounted Yeomen Archers units
Missile strength: +10% for Peasant Bowmen, Herrimaults and Mounted Yeomen Archers units

technology.short_description: As the gates were about to give way, the banner of the dreaded Damoiselle appeared, leading a great host of Knights arrayed in a single lancehead formation. As they cleft their way through the Chaos ranks and shattered the Chaos army Repanse was face to face with the Chaos Lord himself.

effects.description: Effect range: +50% for "Fleur de Lys Banner"
Cooldown: -25% to "Halo of Maidenly Wrath"

ui_effects.localised_text: Explosion does not affect friendly troops

technology.short_description: Artois, where the unified dukedoms swore fealty to the Uniter.

effects.description: Enables an opportunity to confederate with Artois
Chivalry: +100
Diplomatic relations: +100 with Artois

technology.short_description: The sons of Carcassonne bear the symbol of the sword, the insignia of their warrior-culture.

effects.description: Enables an opportunity to confederate with Carcassonne
Chivalry: +100
Diplomatic relations: +100 with Carcassonne

technology.short_description: The insular Asrai are powerful allies yet dreadful, relentless enemies if provoked, so must be treated with reverence and respect around the diplomatic table.

effects.description: Diplomatic relations: +50 with Wood Elves
Campaign line of sight: +25%

technology.short_description: Diplomacy with the grandiose, once-men Tomb Kings requires clever wordplay to leave them always with the sense that the agreed plan is theirs... regardless of one's true intentions.

effects.description: Diplomatic relations: +50 with Tomb Kings
Attrition: -10% casualties suffered from all attrition

technology.short_description: This requires educated men, often those who have studied abroad in the universities of Estalia or the Empire.

effects.description: Leadership: +4 when laying siege or encircling
Missile strength: +10% for Trebuchet units
Reload time reduction: +20% for Trebuchet units

technology.short_description: Do not harm the innocent. You cannot fight for justice by unjust means. Uphold justice where law has failed.

effects.description: Armour: +10 for all non-Knight units
Charge bonus: +25% for Knights Errant units

technology.short_description: King Leoncoeur leads Bretonnia; his symbol, the Shield of Couronne.

effects.description: Enables an opportunity to confederate with Couronne
Chivalry: +100
Diplomatic relations: +100 with Couronne

technology.short_description: One people, one land – all shall know its glory and grandeur.

effects.description: Chivalry: +200
Peasant Economy: +10 peasants available to the faction
Hero action cost: -10%

technology.short_description: No longer can a bad workman blame his tools…

effects.description: Local recruitment capacity: +1

technology.short_description: The wider the plough, the higher the yield, in less time.

effects.description: Income from Farms: +20%

technology.short_description: The horses of Bretonnia are treated better than the smallfolk. Hay stores, for example, allow horses to feed all year round.

effects.description: Construction cost: -10% for Bretonnian Stable and Pasture buildings
Construction time: -40% for Bretonnian Stable and Pasture buildings

technology.short_description: Above all others, Bretonnia is the land of heroes...

effects.description: Character experience gain: +5%
Experience gain: +10% for Bretonnia Knights units

technology.short_description: No steed of the Empire, nor of Estalia or Tilea, could match the strength and power of a pure-bred Bretonnian horse.

effects.description: Vigour loss reduction: -20% for cavalry units

technology.short_description: As the Chaos Lord raised his great sword above his grimacing visage he was momentarily dazzled by Repanse's radiant aura, and she beheaded him in a single strike.  As the dukedom was in joy of being saved, all remnants of the enemy were in dread as they were being pursued to the sea and justly put to death.

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +100% when fighting against Tomb Kings
	(all characters factionwide)
Income from post-battle loot: +25% against Tomb Kings

technology.short_description: "By the King's word - and the eternal grace of the Lady - is Bretonnia governed for the good of its people."

effects.description: Chivalry: +50
Melee attack: +5 for Lords and embedded Heroes
Charge bonus: +5 for Lords and embedded Heroes

technology.short_description: Improve the process and the results look after themselves.

effects.description: Construction cost: -10% for all buildings

technology.short_description: Irrigation ensures that the fields are watered and the people fed, no matter the season.

effects.description: Upkeep: -10% for Infantry units

technology.short_description: The less we depend on the elements, the greater our control over our food supplies.

effects.description: Each of your regions can sustain 1 extra peasant unit(s)
Income from Farms: +20%

technology.short_description: Steeds shod by a trained farrier have better purchase upon the roads and blessed ground of fair Bretonnia.

effects.description: Speed: +10% for Cavalry units

technology.short_description: Blinker hoods restrict the eyesight of horses, making the beasts easier to control.

effects.description: Leadership: +4 for Knight units
Charge bonus: +10% for Knight units

technology.short_description: On the first light of the fifth day, at dawn look to the east.

effects.description: Battle reinforcement time: -25%
Reinforcement range: +50%

technology.short_description: “The King decrees that the Greenskin blight be utterly annihilated wherever, whenever, and however possible!"

effects.description: Chivalry: +4 for every victory against Greenskins
Diplomatic relations: -50 with Greenskins
Immune to Barren Wasteland attrition
Unit experience gain: +100% for units when fighting against Greenskins

technology.short_description: “The King decrees that Bretonnians must double their efforts to defend the Kingdom against the barbaric forces of the North.”

effects.description: Chivalry: +4 for every victory against Norsca
Diplomatic relations: -50 with Norsca
Immune to Snow attrition
Leadership: +4 when fighting against Norsca

technology.short_description: "The King decrees that the threat of Unliving incursions be foremost in the collective mind of the kingdom."

effects.description: Chivalry: +4 for every victory against Vampire Counts
Diplomatic relations: -50 with Vampire Counts
Attrition: -25% casualties suffered from Vampiric territory attrition
Leadership: +4 when fighting against Vampire Counts

technology.short_description: "The King decrees that the scourge of Chaos be stopped at all costs and the land delivered to safety."

effects.description: Chivalry: +4 for every victory against Warriors of Chaos, Chaos Dwarfs and Daemons of Chaos
Attrition: -50% casualties suffered from Chaos Undivided corruption and Chaos Wastes attrition
Leadership: +4 when fighting against Warriors of Chaos, Chaos Dwarfs, Norsca and Daemons of Chaos
Armour-piercing weapon damage: +4 when fighting against Warriors of Chaos, Chaos Dwarfs and Daemons of Chaos

technology.short_description: “The King decrees that from this day forth, the forests of Bretonnia be made safe from the Beastmen’s Ruinous bane.”

effects.description: Chivalry: +4 for every victory against Beastmen Warherds
Diplomatic relations: -100 with Beastmen
Leadership: +4 when fighting against Beastmen
Missile strength: +10% when fighting against Beastmen

technology.short_description: Stealing or copying techniques and forge designs from their Empire neighbours improves Bretonnian metalworking.

effects.description: Income from Iron, Gem and Gold Mines: +20%

technology.short_description: The designs of these mighty furnaces have been taken from Nuln, and are used to create hardened plate.

effects.description: Income from Industry: +10%

technology.short_description: Too long have the Greenskins pillaged Bretonnian lands.

effects.description: Chivalry: +4 for every victory against Greenskins
Diplomatic relations: -50 with Greenskins
Leadership: +5 during subterranean intercept battles
Weapon strength: +10% when fighting against Greenskins

technology.short_description: "In the southern deserts, the dead have ruled long beyond their time. We should put an end to their decaying empire."

Diplomatic relations: -50 with Tomb Kings
Weapon strength: +10% when fighting against Tomb Kings
Unit experience gain: +100% for units when fighting against Tomb Kings

technology.short_description: "The King decrees that the malevolent forces of Athel Loren must be kept at bay."

effects.description: Chivalry: +4 for every victory against Wood Elves
Diplomatic relations: -50 with Wood Elves
Leadership: +4 when fighting against Wood Elves
Missile resistance: 10% when fighting against Wood Elves

technology.short_description: "The King decrees that the shores be secured against the vile raiders from Naggarond."

Leadership: +4 when fighting against Dark Elves

technology.short_description: Bigger bobbins are better bobbins. It is known.

effects.description: Recruitment cost: -10% for all units

technology.short_description: The fruit of such a loom is industry in abundance.

technology.short_description: Peasants can use better leather for thier armour, but not too strong.

technology.short_description: Folding steel takes great skill; the more folds, the stronger and sharper the blade.

technology.short_description: We must not divert our focus from the crusade, each Knight that doesn't fall equates to one less peasant having to take up arms.

technology.short_description: Tournaments are a way for noble knights to gain honour and maintain martial skills during rare glimpses of peacetime.

technology.short_description: Do not forget your roots my Duchess, they all believe in you but they cannot fight well with empty stomachs and belief alone.
